Import shapefile

geoShapefile.Rd

This function imports spatial information in the form of SpatialPolygonsDataFrame, SpatialLinesDataFrame or RasterLayer for use with geoMask().

geoShapefile(fileName = NULL)

Arguments

fileName

the object to be imported. Must be one of SpatialPolygonsDataFrame, SpatialLinesDataFrame or RasterLayer if it is to be used with geoMask().

Examples

# load London boroughs by default
geoShapefile()

#> class       : SpatialPolygonsDataFrame 
#> features    : 8 
#> extent      : 521203.5, 539533.3, 175530.6, 188327.4  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> crs         : +proj=tmerc +lat_0=49 +lon_0=-2 +k=0.9996012717 +x_0=400000 +y_0=-100000 +datum=OSGB36 +units=m +no_defs +ellps=airy +towgs84=446.448,-125.157,542.060,0.1502,0.2470,0.8421,-20.4894 
#> variables   : 7
#> names       :        NAME,  GSS_CODE, HECTARES, NONLD_AREA, ONS_INNER, SUB_2009, SUB_2006 
#> min values  :      Camden, E09000001,  314.942,          0,         T,       NA,       NA 
#> max values  : Westminster, E09000033, 2203.005,    179.707,         T,       NA,       NA
